definitions: practice of establishing political or economic control over foreign territories and exploiting their resources and people
examples: The effects of colonialism still shape international relations today
Many countries gained independence after centuries of colonialism

definitions: person who supports or participates in establishing control over foreign territories
examples: The colonialist viewed expansion as a civilizing mission
Critics denounced the colonialist attitudes in the government

definitions: act of settling in and establishing control over indigenous peoples of an area
examples: The colonisation of Australia began in the late eighteenth century
Historians debate the long-term effects of European colonisation

definitions: person who settles in a new territory while maintaining ties to their homeland
examples: The early colonists faced harsh winters in their new settlement
Many colonists arrived seeking religious freedom and economic opportunity

definitions: act of settling in and establishing control over indigenous peoples of an area
examples: The colonization of the Americas transformed both continents forever
Space colonization remains a dream for future generations

definitions: individual or group that establishes settlements and control in foreign territories
examples: The colonizer imposed their language and customs on local populations
Modern scholars criticize the colonizer mentality of past centuries

definitions: series of regularly spaced columns supporting a roof or upper structure
examples: Visitors strolled through the marble colonnade of the museum
The ancient temple featured an impressive colonnade facing the sea

definitions: medical procedure using a flexible tube with camera to examine the colon and rectum
examples: The doctor recommended a colonoscopy to screen for potential health issues
Regular colonoscopy screenings can help detect problems early

definitions: natural color scheme or pattern found in animals, plants, or objects
examples: The butterfly's coloration helps it blend with flowers
Scientists study bird coloration to understand evolution and adaptation

definitions: pigment or dye used to add color to something
process of applying color to a surface or material
examples: The recipe calls for natural food coloring instead of artificial
She added blue coloring to the frosting for decoration
Children enjoyed coloring in their new activity books
The coloring of the fabric required several careful steps

definitions: professional who specializes in dyeing and treating hair
artist who specializes in applying color in various media
examples: The colorist recommended highlights to complement her skin tone
She trained for years to become a certified colorist
The comic book colorist brought the illustrations to life
As a colorist, he understood how colors affect mood

definitions: visual perception resulting from light wavelengths reflected by objects
substance used to change the appearance of something
examples: The autumn leaves displayed every colour from gold to crimson
She couldn't decide which colour to paint the bedroom walls
The artist mixed several colours to achieve the perfect shade
This colour won't fade even after multiple washes

definitions: natural color scheme or pattern found in animals, plants, or objects
examples: The fish's bright colouration warns predators of its toxicity
Desert animals often have colouration that matches the sand

definitions: pigment or dye used to add color to something
process of applying color to a surface or material
examples: The cake decorator used natural colouring from beetroot
Check the ingredients for artificial colouring before buying
The children spent the afternoon colouring their drawings
Traditional colouring techniques are still used in textile production

definitions: male horse under four years old, especially one that hasn't been castrated
examples: The spirited colt galloped across the meadow with its mother
Training a colt requires patience and consistent handling

definitions: prolonged state of unconsciousness where a person cannot be awakened and shows no response
examples: The patient remained in a coma for three weeks after the accident
Doctors monitored her vital signs while she was in the coma

definitions: toothed device used for arranging or cleaning hair
hexagonal wax structure made by bees to store honey
examples: She ran the comb through her tangled hair each morning
He always carried a small comb in his jacket pocket
The beekeeper carefully removed the honey-filled comb from the hive
Fresh comb honey is considered a delicacy by many

definitions: individual engaged in fighting during a war or armed conflict
examples: International law protects the rights of combatants during wartime
Both combatants agreed to a temporary ceasefire for negotiations

definitions: large ocean wave that breaks on the shore with force
person or machine that combs fibers for textile processing
examples: Surfers waited patiently for the perfect comber to ride
The massive comber crashed against the rocky coastline
The comber worked steadily preparing wool for spinning
Modern textile factories use automated combers for efficiency

definitions: act of arranging or cleaning hair with a comb
process of straightening and cleaning fibers for textile production
examples: Daily combing helps distribute natural oils through your hair
The gentle combing prevented damage to her delicate curls
The combing process removes short fibers from the cotton
Wool combing produces smooth yarn for fine fabrics

definitions: act of bringing together two or more things to form a single entity
examples: The combining of ingredients must follow the recipe precisely
Scientists are combining different approaches to solve the problem

definitions: informal term for a combination of things, especially in food or entertainment
examples: The lunch combo includes a sandwich, drink, and dessert
The jazz combo performed at the downtown club every Friday

definitions: substance capable of catching fire and burning easily when exposed to heat
examples: Store combustible materials away from heat sources for safety
The warehouse contained several types of combustible liquids

definitions: rapid chemical process of a substance combining with oxygen to produce heat and light
examples: Internal combustion engines power most cars on the road today
Complete combustion of fuel produces carbon dioxide and water

definitions: return to prominence or success after a period of decline or absence
examples: The singer staged an impressive comeback after years away
The team's fourth-quarter comeback thrilled their loyal fans

definitions: professional entertainer who performs comedy routines to make audiences laugh
examples: The comedian had the entire audience laughing throughout the show
Many comedians start their careers performing at small comedy clubs

definitions: female professional entertainer who performs comedy routines to make audiences laugh
examples: The comedienne broke barriers in the male-dominated comedy industry
She became a famous comedienne through her television appearances

definitions: someone who comes to a place or event
person showing promise of future success in their field
examples: The restaurant welcomes all comers throughout the day
Late comers will not be admitted once the performance begins
She's an up-and-coming comer in the tech industry
Investors are always looking for the next big comer

definitions: cosmic body of ice and dust that develops a glowing tail when near the sun
examples: The comet was visible to the naked eye for several weeks
Halley's Comet returns to Earth's vicinity every seventy-six years

definitions: punctuation mark (,) used to indicate a pause between parts of a sentence
examples: Place a comma before the conjunction in a compound sentence
The editor added several commas to improve the text's clarity

definitions: officer in charge of a military establishment, camp, or institution
examples: The commandant inspected the barracks every morning at dawn
She was appointed commandant of the military academy last year

definitions: divine rule or law, especially one of the Ten Commandments
authoritative command or instruction that must be obeyed
examples: The Ten Commandments form the basis of Judeo-Christian ethics
Breaking a commandment was considered a serious transgression
The company's first commandment is to always prioritize customer satisfaction
She followed her grandmother's commandment to treat others with kindness

definitions: soldier trained for carrying out raids and special military operations
examples: The commando unit completed their mission under cover of darkness
Elite commandos undergo rigorous physical and mental training

definitions: ceremony or celebration held to honor and remember a person or event
examples: The annual commemoration honors those who served in the war
A special commemoration marked the centennial of the historic event

definitions: object, especially a coin or stamp, made to honor a special event or person
examples: The museum sells commemorative coins featuring historical figures
She collected commemorative stamps from around the world

definitions: act or time of beginning something new
formal ceremony marking graduation from an educational institution
examples: The commencement of construction is scheduled for next month
From the commencement of the project, we faced unexpected challenges
Parents proudly watched their children walk across the commencement stage
The university commencement featured a speech by a Nobel laureate

definitions: official praise or approval given for someone's achievements or actions
examples: The officer received a commendation for bravery during the rescue
Her work earned a special commendation from the board of directors

definitions: person who provides expert analysis and commentary on events, especially in broadcasting
examples: The sports commentator described every play with enthusiastic detail
Political commentators debated the implications of the new policy

definitions: emphasis on maximizing profit and commercial success, often at the expense of other values
examples: Critics argue that commercialism has ruined the holiday spirit
The artist resisted commercialism to maintain creative integrity

definitions: store selling food and supplies on a military base
cafeteria or food service area on a film studio lot
examples: Soldiers bought groceries at discounted prices from the base commissary
The commissary stocks everything from uniforms to household goods
Actors grabbed lunch at the studio commissary between takes
The commissary served meals to hundreds of crew members daily

definitions: act of formally assigning a task, creating an artwork, or putting equipment into service
examples: The commissioning of the new naval vessel attracted media attention
The museum announced the commissioning of a sculpture for the entrance

definitions: official order sending someone to prison or psychiatric care
ceremony of burying or cremating a deceased person
examples: The judge ordered the committal of the defendant to prison
The committal hearing will determine if there's enough evidence
The family gathered for the committal service at the cemetery
A brief committal ceremony followed the memorial service

definitions: male member of a committee, especially in political or organizational contexts
examples: The committeeman proposed changes to the organization's bylaws
Each district elects one committeeman to represent their interests

definitions: naval officer rank above captain and below rear admiral
senior officer of a yacht club or boat organization
examples: The commodore commanded a squadron of destroyers during the conflict
She was promoted to commodore after twenty years of naval service
The yacht club commodore organized the annual regatta
Members elected a new commodore at the annual meeting

definitions: quality or feature shared by two or more people, groups, or things
examples: Researchers found a commonality among all successful entrepreneurs
The commonality between the two cultures surprised the anthropologists

definitions: person without noble rank or title in a society with social classes
examples: The prince's marriage to a commoner sparked media attention
In medieval times, commoners had few rights compared to nobility
